page.title: 04LLANSTEFFAN AREA: HOMES
page.content: Most households use electricity for cooking and some for heating. Mains gas is not laid on; a few people use bottled gas. Some have solid-fuel or oil Agas or Rayburns. 50 to 75 per cent have central heating. Coal or anthracite is burned. The villages have mains water and drainage but some outlying farms and houses do not. Almost everyone has a washing-machine and refrigerator and about 50 per cent have deep-freezes for preserving home-grown and bulk-bought supplies. Carmarthen is the main shopping centre for many people who visit it about once weekly to stock up. Some old fashioned customs persist: many housewives make bread, preserve vegetables and fruit for the winter by freezing or bottling and make wine or cordials, often from wild fruits and flowers, and make jams.
